definition: to enjoy/to benefit/to have the use of

sentences.english: Compassion for other living things is more important than pleasure.
sentences.chinese: 对其他生命的恻隐之心比自身的享乐来得重要。

sentences.english: So couldn't hedonism still be true?
sentences.chinese: 享乐主义仍然是正确的吗？

sentences.english: A year later, I'm here in Lala-land of Hollywood.
sentences.chinese: 一年后，我出现在追求物质享乐出名的好莱坞。

sentences.english: The consumptive idea of Gastronomy has seriously imperiled the sustainable development of society.
sentences.chinese: 享乐主义消费观对社会可持续发展构成了严重的危害。

sentences.english: It seemed that his route to the coveted island was not to be an epicurean one.
sentences.chinese: 看来他渴望去的那个岛不能以这种享乐方式达到。

sentences.english: Bridge Street is a good place to have fun.
sentences.chinese: 大桥街是个能愉悦享乐的好地方。

sentences.english: But haven't yet asked, should we accept hedonism?
sentences.chinese: 但我们还没问，是否应该接受享乐主义？

sentences.english: Still, the hedonist isn't saying from a practical point of view we can necessarily do this.
sentences.chinese: 但享乐主义者并非从实用观点称，我们有必要这么做。

sentences.english: Confucius thought moderate amounts of fun were acceptable.
sentences.chinese: 孔子认为，适度的享乐是可以接受的。

sentences.english: When you spend time having fun, you know you're being self-indulgent.
sentences.chinese: 当你花时间享乐时，你知道你在放纵自己。

sentences.english: Let me just be a hedonist, trying to enjoy my life as much as possible.
sentences.chinese: 倒不如做个享乐主义者，尽情享受生活。

sentences.english: Remember it is her pleasure you are after.
sentences.chinese: 记住，这是她的享乐，而这正是你想看到的。

sentences.english: In hedonistic Las Vegas, six weeks is enough.
sentences.chinese: 在享乐主义的拉斯维加斯，六个星期就足够办完了。

sentences.english: Non-rationalism highlights id, which easily leads to the emergence of the hedonist culture.
sentences.chinese: 非理性主义突出本我，容易造成享乐主义文化的出现。

sentences.english: He knows pleasure but not disaster.
sentences.chinese: 只知纵情享乐，而不知他已面临祸殃。

sentences.english: Eating, drinking and -- not unusual in Tokyo -- makingmerry are all well represented.
sentences.chinese: 尽情地吃喝享乐皆不为怪，东京就是这样一个城市。

definition: to indulge in a life of luxury (idiom); extreme extravagance
to spend one's time in drinking and pleasure (idiom); to indulge in sensual pleasures/life of debauchery
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
